intro: Rinorea belalongii, commonly known as the Bornean rinorea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
